io.spine.testing.logging

Class LoggingTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.testing.logging.LoggingTest
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleLoggingTest

    public abstract class LoggingTest
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract base for tests of logging.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected LoggingTest(java.lang.Class<?> loggingClass, java.util.logging.Level level)

    • Method Detail

      • assertLog

        protected final LoggingAssertions assertLog()
        Obtains the instance of AssertingHandler of this test.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the handler was not initialized or already removed
        See Also:
        interceptLogging(), restoreLogging()

      • loggingClass

        protected final java.lang.Class<?> loggingClass()
        Obtains the class which logging operations are tested.

      • level

        protected final java.util.logging.Level level()
        Obtains the level of logging assigned for the tests.

      • previousLevel

        protected final java.util.logging.Level previousLevel()
        Obtains the level of the logging set for the logging class before the tests.

      • interceptLogging

        protected final void interceptLogging()
        Redirects logging to a custom handler which would accumulate the log output.

        The output can be later asserted.

        The logging will have the level assigned for the test. The method also turns off parent handlers.

        See Also:
        restoreLogging()
        API Note:
        This method is not annotated @BeforeEach to allow derived test suites hook up the logging where appropriate to the test suite. In some cases the logger should be tuned after some of the operations performed in a test setup.

      • restoreLogging

        protected final void restoreLogging()
        Removes the handler assigned in interceptLogging() and restores the value of the flag for using parent handlers.

        The handler is not available after this method is called until it is created and added back by interceptLogging().
